name: Dali Ismail
content: Dali Ismail - Our Faculty | School of Computing | Binghamton University Skip to main content School of Computing Our Faculty Dali Ismail Assistant Professor School of Computing dismail@binghamton.edu 607-777-4590 EB N06 BackgroundDali Ismail is an assistant professor in the School of Computing at Binghamton University. He received his PhD in computer science from Wayne State University in 2021 and his MS from Washington University in St. Louis. His research concerns Internet of Things, mobile and wireless networks, and embedded and real-time systems. He received three best paper awards/nominations in highly competitive conferences, including ACM SenSys (2016 nomination), IEEE ICII (2018 award), and ACM EWSN (2021 nomination). He also received an outstanding teaching award from SIUE School of Engineering (2023).EducationPhD, Wayne State UniversityMS, Washington University in St. LouisBS, University of Science and Technology, SudanResearch InterestsInternet of ThingsWireless networksCyber-physical systemsReal-time and embedded systems Return to Top Last Updated: 3/31/25
